bio.name: Mert Sabinov
description: Hello, I'm Mert Sabinov! I was born in 1999 and I am a computer science student focusing on a career in software development.
I am currently studying Management Information Systems at Istanbul University and also pursuing education in Economics and Administrative Sciences at Trakya University.

My passion and interest in the world of computers, combined with various projects using technologies such as .NET 8 Web API, Java, TypeScript, have allowed me to develop a wide range of software development skills.

Especially through my contributions to open-source projects, I have evolved into a recognized Front End Developer and Full Stack Developer. Taking on the role of a lead developer in projects like Twitch-Stats and BuzzSpire has provided opportunities to enhance both my technical and leadership skills.

Additionally, creating the TypeScript NPM package called responserun-mock to generate random data showcased my abilities in data manipulation. As a successful student, I hold various certifications, solidifying my expertise in areas such as HTML5 Web Development, Introduction to Programming with Go, and Web Programming with REACT.

Keeping up with technological advancements, traveling, exploring different cultures, swimming, watching films and series, personal development, and contributing to open-source projects are just a few of my interests.
In the future, I aspire to further advance my career in the software industry and contribute to technology.

news.content: BuzzSpire Help desk application released as open source
npm package that makes it easy to create mock data responserun-mock
